Paragraph: Patients with an adherence to SOP > 70 % were classified into the high adherence group ( HAG ) and patients with an adherence of < 70 % into the low adherence group ( LAG ) .

In this paragraph, the entities related to disease are:

1. Adherence
2. High adherence group (HAG)
3. Low adherence group (LAG)

Adherence refers to the extent to which patients follow a recommended treatment or medication regimen. High adherence (HAG) and low adherence (LAG) are both related to the concept of adherence, as they are categories used to classify patients based on their level of adherence. Therefore, all three entities are related to the concept of disease, as they are all relevant to the management and study of health conditions.

In this paragraph, the entities that clearly refer to disease are:

1. Adherence
2. Low adherence group (LAG)

Adherence refers to the extent to which patients follow a recommended treatment or medication regimen, which is often used to manage a disease. Low adherence group (LAG) is a category used to classify patients who have a low level of adherence, which can be indicative of a disease or health condition.

Therefore, the entities that clearly refer to disease in the given paragraph are:

1. Adherence
2. Low adherence group (LAG)
